timeline.bodyText: One of the goals of this change in the spec was to enable deferring the generation of a span id when one wasn't needed. Is it possible to defer the spanId creation, and if not, why not?
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -223,13 +223,7 @@ public Span startSpan() {
         traceConfig
             .getSampler()
             .shouldSample(
-                parentContext,
-                traceId,
-                spanId,
-                spanName,
-                spanKind,
-                immutableAttributes,
-                immutableLinks);
+                parentContext, traceId, spanName, spanKind, immutableAttributes, immutableLinks);

replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: @carlosalberto Exactly, this was mentioned on the original spec PR (open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification#621) to improve performance.
replies.author: arminru

replies.bodyText: Follow-up idea (for spec): why not also generate trace ID later? And provide an option for samplers that need it (only one single one: ProbabilitySampler) to optionally generate a trace ID themselves that the SDK will use.
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: Please move this conversation to an issue. I think it is important to fix API first then we can address the optimizations.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I was focusing on avoiding samplers starting to use the SpanId and missed the optimization. Let me see what can be done.
replies.author: pjanotti

replies.bodyText: Changed the code to use SpanId.getInvalid() if the span is not sampled and only generate a new SpanId if it is sampled.
replies.author: pjanotti

replies.bodyText: Please revert the last commit, and don't do the optimization now.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Done, reverted the optimization - didn't see your comment on GH prior to the change...
replies.author: pjanotti
